page.title: 18Railways in Rugby
page.content: Rugby is situated on the west coast mainline, the former L.N.W.R. There is also a freight only line to the Rugby Portland Cement works. At the railway embankment in our area it is possible to see main line and commuter traffic. The line is part of the electrified system, except the freight only line on which there are only two trains per day pulled by diesel traction. It always advisable to note the danger of overhead wires, any contact with the wires (whether a train is coming or not) will almost certainly give you a fatal electric shock. In order to keep people safe the railway line is fenced off.{Do not abuse the {gates or fences, they were built to {keep people out of danger. }
